text:
[h1] UPDATE 15 APRIL 2023 (patch 1.0.3.0) [/h1]

Ok, i completed the game, and i've gone through the various hotfixes and the first 2 main patches (1.0,2.0 and the most recent 1.0.3.0). What can i say... did it get better? Yes and no. Again, i wish steam offered the chance to give it a mixed review rather than a straight negative or positive.

The main issues i discussed in my original review on launch date was insane cpu utlization, insane shader compilation waiting and camera movement jitteriness/microstutters. I would say that sadly, only 1/3 of these issues i've had has been fixed, and not even that well, if i have to be honest.
The cpu utilization slightly went down to around 62/65% compared to the 70/75% on launch, which is still pretty much insane and there's absolutely no reason to it. The shader compilation times are pretty much still the same, maybe 5 minutes faster? On launch it took me something like 55 minutes, on patch 1.0.2.0 it took me around 50, so yeah.
Mouse camera movement jitters have been specifically adressed in a recent hotfix. Did they fix it completely? Yes and no. I noticed that it can still happen on high foliage section and no matter if i use a controller or not (it used to be a mouse only thing) the last chapter, the open area of it, it does it both on mouse and on controller, which clearly shows this game was rushed out the door. Basically, if you want to see how the game was on launch, reach the last chapter (spring) open area. That's how the game played then (if you were able to play it that is). So pretty much i'd say it got fixed 80% of the times (at least it doesnt happen in city and buildings environment. So there's that.

Will i change my vote to a positive? After what you (hopefully) read through, would you? I won't. The game is still feels early access-y to me. No where near being one of the best game of the past few years, from a triple A developing company and from a publisher like Sony. They truly pulled a quick cash grab job with us PC players using their golden goose as bait. The last bit of juice to squeeze for the franchise. It's a shame.

Will i ever come back to update my review once again? Maybe. If i ever re play this game in a year or two just to see if they actually improved their game and not simply put tiny weenie band aid on a wound that goes from the neck down to the belly button. We'll see.


[h1] ORIGINAL REVIEW ON LAUNCH DATE [/h1]

Oh boy... this is rough to say the least.

I'll start to say i have a fairly hi end pc (r7 5800x cooled by a fucking 420 aio from arctic, 32 gb of ddr4 3800mhz cl14, a 6800xt gpu and im running this on my sabrent rocket pci 3.0). All my drivers and bios are up to date. I keep my pc clean and all that good shiz. This game is tough tho, in every sense of the word
.
Im using ultra settings at 1440p and the game runs fine, but there's a one huge problem: it's EXTREMELY cpu bound, to the point that it uses 90% of my cpu (while compiling shaders) and while in game anywhere between 70/75%.
Also the loading times are INSANE. First time i launched the game i had to wait almost 60 minutes to load the shaders. Then when you launch a saved game you have to wait another solid 2/3 minutes for it to load. Friendly reminder i have this installed on an nvme ssd, not a sata ssd. That thing can read at 3.2gb/s and write at 2.9gb/s, so yeah... it is INSANE.

Fair do, im just after the intro of the game, so i still have to load an "open world" save. I'm afraid lol. But yeah, launch isn't looking good. Hopefully they fix it with a patch or two, especially the insanity with the cpu running at 75% for most of the game (aside cutscenes) giving micro stutter as a consequence and high temps ( i have never seen a game making my aio cooled 5800x run at nearly 70 degrees, that usually only happens when i stress test my cpu with something like cinebench multicore).

The real issue here is the mouse camera movement jitters. It's insane and it's very distracting (it feels like your whole screen is tearing, if you don't know what tearing is, look it up on youtube). On controller there's no such issue, and the camera rotations are buttery smooth.

Again, since i loved this game so much when i played years back on ps3 borrowed by a friend, i decided to give it a go considering the other ps port i've played recently (god of war) was fantastic in terms of optimization. I guess this wasn't the case sadly. I should've waited reviews. Finger crossed for as i said, a patch or two to fix the poor cpu performances (im not expecting miracle gpu wise, the game looks amazing so it's fairly normal having the need of a beefy pc to run it the way i do). Also i've seen other people talking about crashes. So far i had none (again, keep in mind i played something like 30 minutes so that might change for me later).

IF YOU HAVE A LOWER END PC (i'd say look at the 1080p recommended from the naughty dog chart) JUST WAIT. Watch benchmarks online of your config (make sure they're using the same cpu too, since as i said right now it is EXTREMELY cpu bound and unoptimized). Don't just look for your gpu. Make sure the benchmark you're looking at uses the same cpu too. 

For now i give it a 5 and i cannot recommend the game right now in this poor state. The game itself is an easy 8/9, but it's a 2 when it comes to the optimization. I will update my review if things get better (or worse). I truly hope all pc players that haven't had the chance to play this game get their chance. Fingers cross they actually fix this.

text: I think it's great that in this remake they took a more artistic approach to the game's narrative. Pay close attention - the game starts by building shaders for 40 minutes in direct reference to the toll humanity took following the outbreak and how long it took to rebuild even the bare minimum of a functioning society. Joel tries to climb past the wall but just can't; it's not a bug or shit optimization, rather it's a metaphor for his inability to climb over his past trauma. When the framerate tanks to 30fps at 1080p medium settings while your $500 CPU runs hot enough to cook an egg, it's all a subtle reference to the eggs Joel was cooking the morning of the outbreak.

text:
Processor: Intel i9 12900KF
Ram: 2x 16GB Corsair Dominator Platinum 5600Mhz
Graphics: MSI Nvidia RTX 3080 10GB

2hrs on record. 30min spent building shaders. Checked the settings - apparently "ultra" is out of reach for me at 1440p. Ok fine, I want a smooth experience I have 165hz monitor - High is 'enough' (not really but I digress). 

Yeah... 
About that...

barely 60-80fps @ 1440p. 
Stuttering, input lag in some areas, black screen flickers at some points. 

Bad port.

I don't know who is using the Ultra setting. I would imagine a 4090 will be choking at Ultra, and maybe squeeze out just enough on high settings. I've not had any crashes but the experience is subpar at most.

Sure its a 1st world problem. Good PC and complains about FPS that some PCs can only dream of.
But I refuse 95%+ usage of my CPU, GPU and RAM.

FIX THE DAMN GAME BEFORE YOU RELEASE IT.

Tldr; If you want to buy a Jet Engine sound simulator this is for you. Otherwise, wait for this optimisation to be fixed.

Edit:

Lets put it into perspective.
PS5 Runs TLoU at 60fps in 1080p, 1440p and 4k.
According to my short google search, in some "performance mode".

Hardware wise:
- AMD Ryzen Zen 8 -> 16 thread @ 3.5GHz
- AMD Radeon GPU with 16GB GDDR6 @ 10 TFLOPS

I'm simplifying this as PS5 hardware works different to PC and is much more embedded.

So you're telling me I can barely push 60fps on 1440p with my CPU and GPU cooking at 95% utilisation, with a spec much better than a PS5, but my experience is worse than a PS5?

Awesome.
I'll take 2 please.

Unbelievable.

text:
I really want this port to be good. I love this game, I played through it on my sisters PS3 back in the day, and the PS4 remaster once I had a PS4. But this is a disgraceful treatment of this game, it deserves better, and iron galaxy should be ashamed. And so should Sony, why didn't they hire Nixxes????

A few of the issues I encountered in just my first 2.5 hrs in the game, and note that I have an RTX 4080 and a Ryzen9 7900X, with 32 GB of RAM, and the game is installed on a SATA SSD. With this hardware I can typically brute force past poor optimization, but here it's not enough. I can't even imagine how much worse this has got to be for people who don't have this type of ridiculous high end rig.

- Mouse movement is EXTREMELY stuttery and unresponsive, regardless of frame rate.
- Performance is REALLY inconsistent. Some sections will go from 100+ FPS down to 60-70 very fast, for no apparent reason. Some sections will run smoothly and some will be consistently low in frame rate, around 60-80 FPS (I know that this isn't necessarily "low" since it's always at least 60 FPS, but based on my hardware and the fact that I'm using a high refresh rate monitor, it feels much less responsive than 60 FPS on a 60 hz native monitor, even with G-sync)
- I tried ultra at first, then high, then medium with some tweaks and then just back up to high and ultra again, regardless of my settings it always seemed to perform just as inconsistently, even though GPU usage did fluctuate.

text:
Now that I'm calmer and have accepted that I won't be able to play this game for another 3 or 4 months, I will try to be helpful to other people.

My PC specs are:

[list]
[*]GeForce RTX 3060 12GB
[*]AMD Ryzen 5 5600X
[*]32GB RAM
[*]The game is installed on an SSHD (a hybrid drive that's better than an HDD, but not as good as an SSD)
[/list]

Apart from all the other problems such as crashes and stuttering, the game doesn't run that well. I get an average of 60fps on 1080p with DLSS quality and any graphical settings. I didn't have any stats on the screen, so I couldn't see if the problem was with my CPU, but my CPU shouldn't have trouble running this game.

I had some texture problems. Even with high settings, some textures looked blurry. If I tried to change graphical settings mid-game, the game would start glitching, and the illumination and textures would get messed up for some time.

I decided that the game wasn't worth my money after the second combat encounter, where it shows you the stealth mechanics. Some of the problems I encountered (SPOILERS for the early game) before that were:

[list]
[*]Almost an hour spent building shadders (not that bad if only done once, but I saw some people saying they had to do it all over again after closing the game)
[*]A lot of stuttering
[*]Audio desync before the car crash, which made the crash really goofy with Sarah screaming a whole 2 seconds before the crash
[*]Really poor performance before and after the Fireflies' attack
[*]After picking up Joel's backpack, the game instructed me to reload my gun by pressing the left mouse button, and to melee with F. I know you reload with R2/R1 in the original game, but that's because they were working with a controller layout, and it's not the same thing with M&K. Fortunately, you can rebind it, but it gave me the impression that the people who ported the game didn't bother to adapt the controls to the PC.
[*]One of the worst things I've seen so far, which I know won't be fixed since it's intentional. When the guy crushed by the locker asked me to mercy kill him, I tried to quickly aim and shoot him but missed his head. For some godforsaken reason, there is a vertical offset to the reticle in this game. Just why? The original game didn't have this issue. Why would I want to aim lower when trying to shoot straight? At this point, I quickly looked at the configs because I knew my 2 hours were almost up, but I couldn't find any option to fix this.
[*]Tess casually killed my FPS when she turned on her flashlight before knocking on the door where the kid opens for her.
[*]At that same scene, I tried to change my settings because the performance was atrocious. After leaving the menu, the game started glitching out, and everything started bugging graphically.
[*]I had to kill the first human enemies by hand because I wasted all my bullets testing the aim offset, but when it came time to finish the last guy, he fell to his knee after a punch, and the game refused to let me punch or grab him for a full 3 to 4 seconds. I could only do something when he started getting up.
[*]At that moment, I was already done with the game. So when I walked behind the guy where you need to stealth him, to my surprise, they changed the stealth mechanics so you are not silent if you're not crouched. That was on me, but I was already fed up, and that was the last straw.
[/list]

I would advise you to save your money and buy the Resident Evil 4 remake instead. The game is really something else. I would even say that it is one of the best games that I've ever played. The last time I was this invested playing a game was with The Last of Us Remastered for the PS4. I wish someday we could get that game for PC.

And if you still want to play this game, these problems are not due to Denuvo since the game doesn't have it. I'll leave it up to you to decide what to do with that information. ;)

Here's my old review, just for a laugh:

Wtf is wrong with this optiomization? rtx 3060 recommended my ass. I'm going back to resident evil 4. Thank you for ruining my favorite game

text:
Please don't hire Iron Galaxy to port your games. They have literally the worst history in PC ports and this is just another in their list of failures. 

 Uncharted on PC is still unplayable months after release and I can't imagine this port will get treated any better.

[UPDATE]

As of April 8th, the game has had several hotfixes and a 14 gb patch to boot. The game is still unplayable. It stutters every few seconds and pretty much destroys the rest of your pc. The framerate is more stable now, but that was never the problem to begin with. Its so unstable and bugged, that even on the lowest settings and after the unreasonably long wait for the games shaders to build, I still stutter almost every 6 seconds and watch several shaders stream in and build before my eyes. 

It's a damn shame that companies as big as Sony/Naughty Dog make the mistake of outsourcing their titles to Iron Galaxy, a studio already infamous for their horrible Pc ports. This standard of quality is never going to pass with pretty much any consumer.

keywords: run, setting, pc, fps, performance, port, even, low, still, well
text:
First, you HAVE to let the shaders compile before playing. It takes a while. About 30-45 minutes for  me. I was at 100% CPU usage (3700x) IN THE MAIN MENUS the entire time. Afterburner says my CPU hit a 107 degree temperature and my 2070 Super was in the high 80s (never seen either of these go above 80-81C before) 
It crashed when I tried skipping the first cutscene (seen it dozen times.) The game is VERY heavy on VRAM. 8 GB cards can use High Texture settings at 1080p with DLSS on quality. Otherwise you're using medium texture settings. It has an accurate VRAM counter, from what I've discovered, unlike Resident Evil 2's. 

Now that I've gotten into playing it, it runs pretty good. I'm at a mixture of high and ultra settings at 60 fps, 1080p with DLSS Quality. Though, it feels like it should run way faster. Heavily relying on FSR and DLSS to push it over the mark. I feel it needs more optimization, for sure. It stutters ocassionally and does have some random spots that shoot up GPU and CPU usage. And I'll tell you right now, this game is HEAVY on the CPU. I'm constantly in the 80% usage (when I've never seen a game use more than 50%) of my Ryzen 3700x. It's an old chip, but still. Maybe that speaks to this game's usage of multi threading. Or it's un-optimization in translation from Playstation to PC? I don't know. But it's going to pound your CPU. 

It's an absolutely INCREDIBLE game, story and even the gameplay is pretty good. Though it is it's weakest part. The graphics options are absolutely top notch. TONS of options to play with and advanced features. In fact, the entire option system is even better than what's found on Playstation. Which was already some of the best in the business when it comes to accessibility options and quality of life tweaks. There is even an FOV slider and persistent center dot option.

Also, v-sync doesn't work at first. You have to go into options after launching game, un-check it and recheck the option on, then apply. I know everyone is freaking out about the port, and I initially was too. But I think a lot of these reviews were left by people trying to play before shader compilation. Which to be fair, is insane. I've never had a game take that long. It should be part of the installation process, "hidden" and mandatory. But still, since there's no MEH option on Steam, I have to give this a thumbs down for now. Simply for the issues with the shader compilation, crashing (I've had 6-8 times in 2 hours) and general unoptimization. I have a feeling that even though my PC is almost 5 years old now, Ryzen 3700x and 2070 Super with NVME drives, I imagine folks with even lesser PC's will struggle to run this at acceptable graphic options. You're going to be playing on low and medium, for a Remastered 2013 game if you have like... a 1080 or whatever the equivalent AMD card is.

text:
I've gotta say I'm pretty disheartened and disappointed with the way this port turned out. The original game was amazing and I think we all know that by now, so I was really looking forward to the PC release where I could play this game in all its glory. For context, I have a 3060 ti, which is a relatively decent graphics card - I'm usually able to play most games at 1440p and 60 frames with no issues, usually better. I understand that this game is a remake which means new graphics and improvements, but this game isn't necessarily pushing any huge graphical boundaries. While the PS5 version looks beautiful, it still isn't competing with games like Red Dead Redemption 2 or even The Last of Us Part 2. Realistically, this game should be running pretty smooth with no problem at all, especially with a PC graphics card.

When I booted up the game, my frame counter showed 15-30 frames on the menus! I wasn't super worried at first since sometimes there is a short adjustment and buffering when you first boot up a game, but the issue persisted. By default, my PC had the settings on high and medium, so I changed some things to lower settings to see what kind of frame increase I could get. Still, in the menus, I am getting less than 30 frames. It's a damn window with some flowing blinds....really? Okay, so before I start, I'm also looking at about 5% of my shaders being complete, and I've already spent 5-10 mins working on the graphics settings. How long is this going to take to load in? I already waited for a second install after the game unlocked, and I still haven't even broken through the menu. Screw it, I'm playing the game, the shaders can wait. Well, the intro cut scene is getting about 45-55 frames. Not ideal, but doable I suppose. Was definitely hoping for a little more. Once I'm actually playing as Sarah and walking around the house, I am lucky to get 45 frames, but I'm hovering closer to 35. Pretty disappointing, especially after already lowering some settings. Okay, I'm a little frustrated at this point with the performance, but let's lower the settings more and see what I'm getting. At the lowest settings I'm bouncing around 45-55 frames, but it's jumpy. As we are going through the truck sequence and driving through the city, I get hit with "please wait". I'm assuming that's because the shaders aren't loaded in completely, so maybe my fault, but really, I feel like that's a little bizarre to have in a game that is supposed to be well optimized. Anyway, as I play through the remainder of the intro, I am experiencing some significant frame drops, which were already low to begin with. The textures absolutely suck too because I'm playing on the lowest setting. 

Okay... time for a break, I'm just gonna wait for the shaders to load in and try again. I leave my PC for about 30 mins and come back. I'm at 37%... Dear lord this game is going to be the end of my sanity. So I hit up my friend with a brand new 4080 build, which should probably run this game with no issues...right? Well, sounds like it's not quite as bad as my situation, but on high settings, he still gets 60 or less frames.... with probably one of the best graphics cards available right now. Sounds like the optimization is poor all around. So at this point, I'm less than 50% loaded in with the shaders and I have close to an hour of running the game, do I still wait and try to run with the shaders? Or do I refund this thing and save my money? That's about where I am right now.

Okay, so final thoughts. In all honesty, never waited for the shaders to finish loading in. I get that, but based on what everyone else is saying and some other performance metrics from a better build, it's not really looking that great. Maybe there will be a patch coming soon to boost performance, who knows? I find it really interesting that there was not a single review of the PC version of this game up before release. As of right now, I still can't find one. I'm not trying to hop on the bandwagon and hate this game, but realistically it does seem really poorly optimized. I took work off for this and I'm pretty upset with the result that this port turned out to be. I am a fan of The Last of Us, and I was really looking forward to this release. Hopefully they get it fixed. I guess I will hold onto it for a few days and see if anything changes, but right now I am definitely leaning toward the refund.

Update 2: Giving this another shot with latest drivers and version 1.0.4.1. While it performs better, CPU usage is still insanely high (lower than when it launched) for no reason, thus FPS is not stable and the overall performance is not yet ideal. GPU and VRAM usage have been greatly improved. I have also upgraded to 32 GB ram from 16 and my overall ram usage exceeds 18 GB and I don't have anything running in the background.

Update 3: Version 1.0.5. Game runs significantly better compared to launch but it's still not where it was supposed to be. At least now it's playable (at least for my hardware). I had stable 60 FPS on a mix of High and Ultra settings on 1080p for the majority of the game but CPU usage still remains above 70% and I really don't get why. Especially when there are no NPCS in the area or there's nothing going on. While the game is really good I still can't recommend it due to the atrocious state it launched in and it took so many updates just to get it into a playable state. I commend Naughty Dog for actually updating and fixing the game but it's not enough. We are in 2023. Games SHOULD and MUST launch in a better state especially when it's a triple A game like this published by companies like Sony. It really hurts me having to give it a thumbs down even though I really liked the game but it is what it is.

1.0.1.5: new patch today, the framerate, gpu cpu usage and memory leaking issues seem to have been cleaned up a little bit but the game crashes more often now and always crashes in the first cutscene you meet Marlene in, pretty much the same place each time too. Using the oo2core from Warframe further improves these issues but only by a slight amount. still unplayable + crashes my steam deck every time after about 5 mins of shader compilation or after loading for a couple minutes, using GE7-47, Proton EX and Proton 7.06 all produce largely the same results with a few small deviations, if you really want to play it on the deck i reccommend Proton Experimental using the Low graphics settings [the default medium graphics are way too high for the deck]

1.0.1.6: stuttering is even worse in this hotfix, the crash on the previous cutscene [where you first meet marlene] has not occurred in this version for me, however it did crash in the cutscene where joel is sleeping on the couch in an apartment while it rains and ellie is *looking out the window before they leave town. Memory usage is a bit lower but still not exactly playable

1.0.1.7: stuttering is much worse again, crashes are so much more frequent, the experience on lowest settings on the Steam Deck [2TB NVME] is terrible, staying at around 1-3 FPS. This game is fucked if they can't fix this shit really soon, because it should have been fixed by now, they claim that they are fixing things but it just does not seem to be true, if you want to play this game just play it on PS3 / PS4 / PS5 or, better yet, PLAY DAYS GONE!!! :)

1.0.2.0: new patch just shipped yesterday, took me till now to load the shaders, i have started the game using the continue button, after about 5 seconds after loading it crashes i have tried this 4 times, once on the deck, and three times on my computer, i am not sure what happened with this update but there you go, for the few, precious, seconds i was in the game the framerate was around 20 FPS with all the settings at the lowest possible, AMD FSR 2.0 <3 at ultra performance with some major stuttering for a few seconds at a time but other than that, it worked fine enough till it crashed :/

***Change to 3440x1440***

1.0.2.1: mostly just the same, the stuttering seems to be a smidge better but the framerate seems bad, didnt crash with the short amount of testing i did though.

1.0.3.0: shaders compiling again, took about 2 - 3 hours, crashed twice at about 50% and 80%. finally shaders are done so i try to load into the game, took 10 mins to get to about 35% and then crashed, aint trying it again after that

***upgrade to 32GB RAM***
***upgrade CPU to Ryzen X3D***
***GPU drivers are up to date at what they recommend***

1.0.5.0: shaders again but this time it took about 30 minutes, still really bad but for what it's worth it has clearly improved a lot and is not that long anyway just frustrating, fps seems to have possibly improved and for the short while i played [5 minutes] the stability and stuttering were really good, i would definitely not buy it yet but its probably not a terrible experience if you meet the minimum specs but do be prepared for god awful graphics, if you meet recommenced however, it may be a decent experience. I am upgrading to a high end gaming GPU tomorrow so i will see how the performance is there, i apologise that i can no longer update my review based on my original specs, it was fun and i did miss a few revisions but if there is somehow, someone reading this then i hope you can enjoy this game either now or in the near future. thank you for reading, also if you are somehow still reading this then please consider trying out Days Gone, it is insanely good and if you like open world games then there you go. Again, thank you.

text:
[h1] SUBSTANTIAL OPTIMIZATION NEEDED [/h1]

[b] After experiencing the show and previous iterations of this game, I really really REALLY wanted to love the PC edition and finally get to play the remaster in all its graphical glory. Unfortunately, given the current state of the game, this is impossible. [/b]

[i] My Specs: CPU: i7 7700K | GPU: GTX 1080ti [/i]

Even on lower graphical settings, this game looks absolutely stunning, however with my specs above, I was barely able to keep 50fps on medium graphics downgrading to 1080p resolution. The need for a NASA computer to run this game at even a smooth 60fps honestly ruins most of the immersion for me and leaves me extremely disappointed overall. Seamless transitions between game play and cut-scenes are gone and instead replaced with jarring "please wait" signs overlaid onto the screen for between 30 seconds and 2minutes. These also occurred mid game play sections which further ruined the feeling of being immersed.  Also, 2 hours of playing and the shaders still haven't finished compiling? Insane.

Gameplay so far has been mostly enjoyable, however the AI of Tess in particular seemed extremely poor? Her character kept running around past enemies during stealth areas which honestly again just detracted from the game. I've also experienced several cases of characters glitching into objects and doing the dreaded T-POSE effect. 

Overall, I sincerely hope Naughty Dog do this remaster the justice it deserves because right now I'm honestly just disappointed and considering my hype before release, already find myself losing desire to continue playing, I wish I could give this a positive review but that would just be plainly untrue. 

I'll update both once finishing the game and when Naughty Dog / Iron Galaxy addresses the problems I've listed.

text:
Day one experience:
Simply horrible optimization/performance, compared to Resident Evil 4 remake, this game is simply a flop, I have already predicted it, and thank you for not disappointing me, just a waste really, and now I have to wait till the shader building is on 100% to even bother playing a game that I watched a TV show based on it, and been out for years in console, nice move though, just so no one be able to refund the game after 2 hours play time waiting their shader building to be done, well done.

Day two update:
Still left the whole shader crap to be done, launched the game, runs like crap with tons of fps drops, even way worse than how cyberpunk 2077 launched in release day, game freezes randomly during battles, stutters, and some voice stuttering here and there, simply runs as unfinished game, I tried messing around with the settings even tried the dlss ones, they somehow improved the quality and the fps in general, still the hard fps drops just ruins the experience and makes the game hardly playble or worth the suffering through the fps drops, luckily I didn't face any crashing issues yet, except the game froze up once with me.

Let's not forget the people who leave a "thumb up" review while complaining of the game issues, I have read multiple of them just to boost the review up to mixed, basically kissing on Sony's butt so Sony doesn't get mad and take their exclusive and go home and be mad on PC players, as if sony some little spoiled girl, and making that little girl is important so they don't fire your parents of work, when Sony is a multi billion company.

If they can't release a working game from their exclusive glorious console, better stop doing it and keep them for consoles.

After few patches and even a big patch, the game is still hardly playable, and even after finishing the game, there is really nothing else to do, I'm just surprised how this game was super hyped as one of the best games and the game play is very basic as if the game is really outdated from 2013, which was the actual release for it, the hardest puzzle in game is to find a ladder or a wooden thing so you can proceed to the next area.

The enemies just felt mindless and easy to abuse and fool around, the only times I died on was because of the game stuttering and dropping my fps which made my aim goes all the way around, I can say MAYBE the human enemies are anything, but other than that even the bloaters are a joke.

Honestly I can't say I had a blast, the HBO show somehow was having a better story telling than how it was in the game, which even almost made me feel like "I know what gonna happen next" since I already watched it, so the game didn't bring much to it, it's simply a re-re-remastered version of the 2013, people claim they "remade" the game when it's almost basically the exact same as the 2013 with few model faces, the graphics wasn't even that impressive and then you will have people trolling that you need a super decent PC to run it on max for the best graphics, nah it already looks outdated in general.

So my Negative review will remain, for multiple reasons, and I don't plan to change it, because simply I pre-ordered this game and I expected it to be actually good or at the very least playable, but nah, after every patch you have to wait for the shaders to build up and waste your time, if not the shaders building for more than 2 hours I would of already refunded it, and got it when it goes in a sale and fixed.

According to some stuff I've read the version of the dll included causes crashes due to memory leaks. That has fixed my game so far and no more crashes as of now. I still don't recommend due to the issues and most people having to fix the game themselves. Wait for a patch.

text:
v1.0.4:

1 month after release and I've completed the game fully, having to go through shader caching 4 times after each update 40mins to 1 hour each. And no, even after 4 patches (60GB total), the game has barely improved in performance on a 3060ti/5600x/32gb ram system.

• Overall Visuals - 8/10
	- Vast improvement over the original, but lacking by today's standards and features.
	- Level Design for a linear story game in parts is mind-boggling, with dozens of 	pointless alleys with no reward at the end of them for explorers (Why do this?).

• Mechanics - 5.5/10
	- Game mechanics have aged terribly since the original, spam pick-up gear > craft >
	repeat.
	- In a game about survival you'd expect the MC to know how to count bullets when 	they pick them up, but no, when missing just 1 bullet from a firearm both Joel & Ellie 	will make the leftovers disappear like magic!
	- Above average stealth mechanics.
	- Repeat of the same 3 level clear minigames.
	- Enjoyable and gratifying combat mechanics.
	- Bugs that have existed since the PS5 release are still present, one that forces you to
	skip a minigame, otherwise your save is soft-locked.

• Audio - 9.5/10
	- Very good audio accuracy and quality.
	- Audio sometimes desyncs in cinematics.

• Story - 8/10
	- Even though I knew the full story from years ago, it was still an enjoyable 	experience.
	- A medium-length linear story.

• DLC - 4/10
	- Wandering in an abandoned shopping mall simulator.
        - Performance is even worse than the main game.

• Performance - 2/10
	- FPS dips to 40s on a custom mix of low/medium/high settings @ 21:9 1440p 	resolution (vram usage 7.5gb).
	- 720p Low preset vram usage is over 6GB, even though the minimum specs 	recommend a 4GB GPU lole...
	- At specific angles objects in some levels will disappear.

• Pricing - 1/10
	- Perfect pricing for consumer pigs.
	- Laughable since the game has been out for 10 years...

• Overall - very light 5.5/10, absolutely terrible port, and a spit in the face of the PC master

text:
[h1]Optimization is horrible 💀 lmao[/h1]

Wait until Naughty Dog fixes this mess. There are minor bugs visually for example in the beginning of the game my screen would randomly become a texture mess with a bunch of colors just splattered all over my screen, and as my character would get attacked by zombies and reload the level, it would get worse and worse, and there are minor game play bugs and animation bugs that I encountered, some were game breaking while others were minimal bugs. It has crashed a few times while playing as well, I have had some instances where I was forced to reload the game/thought the game was going to crash due to sudden lag or stuttering (keep in mind my specs are in my opinion extremely above average). The characters sometimes block your way in certain missions, in the sewer section of the game Ellie blocked me from moving forward forcing me to restart my game. There is also a stuttering issue with KB&M, which is the main control for PC, this is mostly seen when using your mouse to move your view around at all and is very noticeable. My cpu also gets scarily hot and stays at 100% usage all the time while the game is running. Other than that this game is absolutely beautiful and stunning, story is amazing character design is immaculate and I am having a blast playing it, but the port is AWFUL, I cannot recommend this game in its current state and for SIXTY DOLLARS!?? There is a fierce disregard for PC optimization and with a month delay this is unacceptable, + a $60 price tag makes it unbelievable. I had extremely high hopes for this game but am dissatisfied in the product I received, Sony/Naughty Dog, we need clarity on these issues and fast. For these reasons I cant recommend this game especially for people who have lower end PC's.


[b]TLDR: Optimization bad, bugs, needs fixing! ASAP[/b]

For reference I played this on a LAPTOP  RTX 3080 + Ryzen 9 5900HS 

I got around 20 - 40 fps on ALL max settings with DLSS on quality and 1440p, and a solid 40 - 60 fps on the game recommended settings at 1440p with DLSS on performance. Keep in mind I am playing on a laptop screen. Even on the recommended settings I have not even been able to go past 60 fps with my specs which is shocking. 

I recommend waiting until the game is fixed and worked on continuously by the teams at Naughty Dog. Many of the other Sony ports have worked FLAWLESSLY, this game should not be treated any differently.This game is amazing, but as of now it requires you to have a NASA tier computer and two 4090's just to run it at above 60 fps. That is not right, I will be finishing the game as I already spent 70 dollars on the deluxe edition, and want to experience the rest, but I cant help to feel severely disappointed in this ports performance and am hopeful that the issues I addressed are swiftly attended to so many other PC users can enjoy this spectacular game on the many different types of PC's.

text:
For some reason I decided to purchase a game (that I played on PS3 11 years ago) for 70 Canadian dollars so here is my honest review of this ""port"".

I consider my PC slightly more above end then average: Ryzen 7 3800x, 32 GB of ram, rtx 2060 super, modern M.2 NVMe storage. While I mostly use this PC for VMs it is also built to be a gaming PC that can run most games at a frame rate above 120fps preferably 143 as that is my monitors refresh rate. It sure was a shoooocker to find that this port did not at all deliver in any performance factors at all. To start off the game is almost 100 gigabytes large which is some incredible bloat code for an eleven year old game and some how rivals call of duty games. After a 15 minute download (I HAVE GOOD INTERNET) I was greeted by the game compiling shaders for 30 minutes presumably to get around steams refund policy. Opening task manager I could see that the menu alone was using anyway between 80 to 99% of my CPU at random and was given my VRAM a run for its money. After shaders finished compiling I picked hard mode and attempted to load in to be greeted by a crash. The game crashed 2 more times within my 2 hours of gameplay but that is besides the point. The loading times for menus and stuff were abysmal considering I am loading the game off of one of the fastest storage devices on the market. In-game the fps is terrible and I am forced to turn down all of my graphics settings to low so that I can achieve 80 fps, so instead I stay of medium settings and cap my fps at 60. In settings motion blur is default which is a mistake because that chunks fps even more. The default controls for mouse and keyboard are bad, how come the only bind for medkit is 7? also quick turn should be removed because it is useless of m&k and I clicked it many times on accident. Luckily you can rebind all controls so these complaints are nullified. The price of the game is atrociously high especially considering they were giving this game away free with early PS4 releases. If you do not have money for this game and want to play it on PC but do not have the money RPCS3 are working towards getting comparable performance with this port, kek.

On to the good side. The game is a certified classic and super fun, but for this price range at this subpar performance I cannot recommend it. 

*Refunded at 1.9 hours to guarantee my refund.

text:
*UPDATE 25/11/2023

The game has a great artstyle and great story-line. Yet, let's not forget how utterly horrible the release was. Unfortunately, there is no amount of work that Sony and Naughtydog can do to undo the horrible experience I had on release for a AAA title. The fact that they jacked up the price after release was very scummy, not to mention this game doesn't even include multiplayer is also pretty scummy. So yeah, my negative review will stand. F*** the greedy CEOs for releasing this product in such a state.

[strike]Not good impressions at all.

I tried pre-loading this game to get it up and running for a stream. The f***ing unpacking sequence was as long as f***ing preloading the game. Like, what the actual f*ck? Delaying the release by an hour and making me sit for another hour for just unpacking? It took as long as the install! WHY!

Furthermore, in all seriousness, I'm running an RTX 3070, Ryzen 9 5900X, and 64GB of CL 18 3600mhz RAM and all of a sudden, it's considered obsolete at this point? I can only run low settings? Are you kidding me? Not to mention, the game crashes every 20 minutes or so. Jeeze, this release was a mess.

In short, Sony, I dare you release Part II. The second that releases it's going to end up in the mostly negative reviews.

This is what happens when you trust a company like Iron Galaxy that has a long history of terrible PC ports. WHY???

*UPDATE

For those witnessing this horrible release, the game runs pretty decently in proton on Pop!_OS and for those who have a Debian based OS, I would recommend you try it there and see if it runs for you fairly smoothly. I got a consistant 60fps at medium settings on Linux and I'd expect about the same performance for anyone else using arch as well.

*UPDATE
I should also mention that turning on DLSS helped a ton. I can imagine that FSR would also help quite a bit, but I'm not sure since I don't have an AMD card. It seems like DLSS performance offers the most benefit to fix the issue right now. Literally, the game is only playable if you're able to run DLSS or FSR without completely tanking your FPS with a card under 10GB of VRAM. Pretty sad.

*UPDATE

Sad to report with even the latest 3 patches, including the recent Nvidia GPU patch, this game still runs like garbage. I'd still suggest staying away from this game for now until it gets better.[/strike]

I'm going to make a little mini review on both the Regular Desktop Version and the Steam Deck Version of this game I have updated this so far 4 times.

Desktop Version: This game's desktop version runs pretty okay after a year of this game being out with updates being constantly pushed out which to say the least isn't that amazing the game runs natively at High Settings for my setup albeit not at an amazing FPS the FPS typically sits at around 45 - 60 on High settings and only reaches above that at around 75 - 80 on Medium Settings the game still has some pretty major stuttering here and there but the game is most definitely playable it still takes up an insane amount of RAM to run but it runs decent and can be played.



Steam Deck Version: I do NOT recommend you play this game on the Steam Deck the game runs perfectly fine up until particles start showing up which is pretty bad cause there are a lot of particles in specific areas of the game, The game runs natively at Low settings and STILL runs terrible it took me from the epilogue to one of the first zombie fights before it started chugging hard I entered the little area with the guy trapped under the rubble and was immediately hit with a FPS drop that went down to about 8 FPS averaging it got so bad that I couldn't even use any of the buttons on my Steam Deck to exit out of it and my fans were running LOUD this game is not good on the Steam Deck and shouldn't be verified for it at all.



Final Thoughts: This game is still badly optimized even after almost a year of it being out on PC I honestly believe it shouldn't have released until atleast Late 2024 if your computer is lesser than maybe a GTX 1060 6GB and a i5-7400 I wouldn't recommend grabbing this game at all it takes up way too much RAM and only runs OKAY do not buy this game in it's current state unless you have a very powerful PC.

text:
Update after patch (7th April):

TLDR: VRAM

Performance is still pretty abysmal. Medium/low settings, 1440p downscaled to 720p and I can still barely get 60fps. CPU usage is still 100% whilst my GPU usage is sitting around 60% (probably because I had to downscale resolution because of VRAM). 

VRAM is the issue here and needs to be optimised more and properly. I'd say probably 85% of people on PC are using something with 8GB or less VRAM and considering cards as new as the 3070ti only have 8GB VRAM, it's unrealistic to expect a game to sell well on PC when a mixture of low and medium settings can't even play properly on above recommended hardware because of the VRAM usage. Even medium settings on 1080p use almost 8GB VRAM. 

Essentially - if your card only has 8GB of VRAM, no matter how good it is for any other game out there, the game's VRAM usage will cap you at medium graphics on 1080p and low/medium on 1440p, and, as I said in the original review, playing this game on anything lower than medium (with low in a few irrelevant settings) makes the game look worse than the original game looked on the PS3, which is insane to me considering that - had the original game been ported to PC, it probably would've had 10x better performance and also looked better than the low settings of this version. 


Original Review:

Can already tell this will probably be an unoptimised mess. Maxed out CPU (I have above recommended) in the menu and takes almost 8GB of VRAM for medium settings at 1080p. Also 45 minutes in and I've not even started the game because it's still only on "Building Shaders: 30%", at this rate it's going to take over 2 hours to build shaders which is beyond ridiculous and shouldn't be a thing unless you are literally playing on a potato with a HDD.

Edit of Original Review:

After over an hour of building shaders, I got into the game just to find that in order to get a relatively decent performance going (<60fps), I need to pretty much play a mix of medium and low settings - with the low settings making the game look worse than it did on the PS3 in some areas and still getting very bad stuttering and small freezes. Even turning DLSS (with 1440p) on did absolutely nothing for my performance. The optimisation is just bad. 

Don't get me wrong, TLOU Part 1 is an amazing game, one of my all time favourites in fact, and if they fix the performance I would 110% recommend this game to absolutely everybody but as of right now, I don't recommend it - which sucks.

text:
EDIT Patch 1.0.1.6 - 31st March 2023: The game maxed out in 4K on my 4090 with no DLSS now uses circa 3.5GB vram less, and 4-5GB RAM less. From 17.5GB Vram (with what the game considers "os vram usage") and 31GB Ram, to 14GB VRAM and 27GB RAM

EDIT after 18h and having finished both the main game and DLC, plus 86% achievements, and like 80% of all collectibles in the whole game. To the problems that I mentioned before (in the rest of my review) add the following:
1) Entire chapters where the game runs between 23-31FPS (I completed it like this, thanks to my youth of low fps games). Thankfully I had Black Frame Insertion + GSync + VRR, otherwise it would have been even more horrible than it is.
2) There is a memory leak, the more you play the lower the FPS. After 3h it becomes unplayable.
3) For me the game crashed only once, 1h before the end of the game, once I entered a random room with 0 enemies or loot, so nothing crazy was happening. The game crashed so hard, that even after 10mins, I couldn't use Windows and I had to force reset the PC. The crash was so bad, poor windows started installing the latest updated on startup.
4) Frametime is horrible. You can have a stable FPS, but the frametime will vary by 5-10ms constantly.
5) The mouse feels like it skips frames.
6) Something I haven't encountered in the PS3 original,  PS4 remaster nor PS5 remake, characters TPosing in cutscenes and even during horse rides (which was pretty funny), and characters plus items clipping through the geometry and flickering a lot.
7) A lot of shimmering even without an upscaling technique applied.

The game is good as always, but don't buy this for now, the port is horrendous.


EDIT after 2h of playing:
1) The loading screens are everywhere and TAKE FOREVER. I can load Cyperpunk 2077 like 15 times in the amount this loads once. And this on a Crucial P3 nvme (3500MB/s read speed) and 128 thread @ 4Ghz CPU.
2) If you change any setting in the game, the game takes forever to reload the textures and all the changes. Many times it just stops halfway through, and just stay like that.

Changed the review to negative until they fix their stuff.

Played it for 1h, finished it 6 times on PS3 and PS4. The game is great, however the port is just decent:
1) The shader compilation take 55 years to complete (even though I am on a 128 thread cpu). So every time you update your graphics driver you will have wait 55 years.
2) The game literally pauses with a thumbnail every few minutes if you try to play while having the shaders compile in the background.
3) The mouse movement feels weird, similar to the uncharted port.
4) The 3D Sound Audio is bugged and during cutscenes (I haven't tried gameplay) will have very low volume to dialogue. I had to switch to Stereo to be able to play the game, 5.1, 7.1 or 3D Audio is just not good right now (Returnal works fine for example with 3D Sound).
5) The framerate is all over the place, even with a 4090.
6) No exclusive fullscreen available, similar to God of War or Uncharted. Therefore, any custom resolutions you may have, they are gone.
7) No "PC Tech" present. Nvidia Reflex (present in Spiderman and God of War) is not present here. Frame generation (present in Spiderman) is not present here. XeSS not present. DLAA not present. DRS cannot be used either.

So yeah, BIG thumbs up for the game, thumbs down for the port. This review is positive just cause TLOU1 is that good.

text:
My Dear Albert,

I do hope this epistle finds you in good health and high spirits. It is with great pleasure that I impart a recent discovery that hath occupied much of my leisure. A game titled "The Last of Us" hath been procured on Steam.

I confess, this game is unlike any I have beheld before. It is situated in a world devastated by a fungal infestation, and the remnant survivors must fight for their very existence against infected humans and other perilous adversaries.

The game possesses an incredible sense of realism, with breathtaking graphics and sounds that ring true. I find myself completely absorbed in this wondrous world, and oftentimes I lose track of time whilst indulging.

Verily, some may view such indulgences as trivial, but I implore thee to remember that leisure and respite are essential, even amidst the flurry of our daily lives. Additionally, I have found that games, like "The Last of Us," doth enhance my faculties, improving my analytical skills and logical reasoning.

I pray this missive finds thee in good stead, and I earnestly hope that thou art likewise enjoying thyself during these distressing times. Do write back and inform me of thy welfare and wellbeing.

With all my affection and esteem,
Benjamin Franklin
